Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this medical condition came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.
Allows for establishment of timelines between condition onset date, reported date and recorded date.
The date on which the medical condition was reported.

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the medical condition was recorded. The location of entry should always be known, and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the service delivery location where the medical condition was recorded.
Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED
Code is fixed to DX if not using SNOMED
Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with contraindication checking.
A record of a patient's medical condition. Includes diseases, disabilities, pregnancy, lactation and other clinical conditions of interest.
Allows for direct referencing of a medical condition record when querying or updating and is therefore mandatory.
Unique identifier for medical condition record.
Identifies this observation as reporting a medical condition and is therefore mandatory. When using SNOMED, the actual condition may be post-coordinated into this attribute, thus CD is used.
If SNOMED is used, the diagnosis will appear here. Otherwise, a fixed value of "DX" should be sent.
Indicates what kind of condition is being reported.
Essential to evaluating the relevance of the condition record. In some cases, it may not be known whether the condition still exists or not. Therefore the status is treated as 'populated'.
A coded value that indicates whether the condition is still impacting the patient. 'ACTIVE' means the condition is still affecting the patient. 'COMPLETE' means the condition no longer holds
Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the medical condition.

The date on which the condition first began and when it ended.

For ongoing conditions such as chronic diseases, the upper boundary may be unknown.

For transient conditions such as pregnancy, lactation, etc; the upper boundary of the period would usually be specified to signify the end of the condition.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Denotes access restriction placed on the medical condition record. Methods for accessing masked medical condition records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.
This is the central piece of information in recording a condition. However because when using SNOMED the actual diagnosis will be sent in the 'code' attribute, this element is optional.
A code indicating the specific condition. E.g. Hypertension, Pregnancy.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.
Identity of the provider who is taking responsibilty for the actions of the author.

Shows whether additional information is available on further drill-down. This association behaves like a mandatory attribute where the presence of the association represents 'true' and the absence of the association represents 'false'
If true, indicates that there are notes associated with the allergy or intolerance.
AllergyIntolerance.person
Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the person affected by the condition
Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.
Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this medical condition record.
Identifies the specific condition record to retrieve and is therefore mandatory.
Identifier of the Condition record to be retrieved. This can pertain to an allergy/intolerance or medical condition record.
Root class for query definition
Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response
Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the date on which the patient was born.
Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.
Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid
Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the condition history query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.
Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

The name of the patient who is the subject of the condition history query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.
Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.
A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.
Value must not be present when using SNOMED, mandatory otherwise
Provides evidence for recording the allergy/intolerance.
Indicates the specific allergy test that supports the recording of the allergy/intolerance.
Allows an allergy/intolerance test record to be directly referenced.
An identifier for a specific instance of an allergy/intolerance test.
Allows different kinds of allergy/intolerance tests to be distinguishable and is therefore mandatory. It uses the CD type to support SNOMED post-coordination.
A coded value denoting the type of allergy test conducted.
Allows providers to evaluate the currency of the test.
The date on which the allergy test was performed.

Allows other providers to evaluate the test. There is no point in associating an allergy test with unknown results with an allergy or intolerance however the element is optional because this information may be post-coordinated in the 'code' attribute using SNOMED.
A code indicating result of the allergy test.
AllergyIntolerance.authorizingProvider
AllergyIntolerance.authorizingPhysician
Identifies responsibility for accuracy and relevance of the information. This association reflects primary responsibility, and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the provider who reported the allergy or intolerance.
Identifies timing of allergy/intolerance for sorting and for audit purposes. Attribute is populated because the source of the data may not be through the 'record common observation' interaction.
The date and time on which the allergy/intolerance record was created.

In an EHR integrated health services environment, it is important that other providers are able to query who is responsible for a given change. Also used by applications for auditing and sorting. The attribute is mandatory because the responsible provider should always be known.
Identity of the health service provider responsible for the change in the allergy/intolerance status.

Gives other providers the frame of reference in evaluating any post-change issues with the allergy. Also used for sorting and audit purposes. Time of change is always known and thus the attribute is mandatory.
The date on which the change was made.
Value is required if not using SNOME code must be RXNASSESS if not SNOMED

Helps providers to distinguish between proper allergies and intolerances. Allows the provider recording the allergy to assign appropriate severity to the allergy. May give insight on how to mitigate an intolerance that is likely to be triggered by administering a substance. (E.g. If a given drug typically causes nausea in the patient, an additional medication may be co-prescribed to manage the nausea.)
This is a recording of a patient reaction that is believed to be associated with the allergy/intolerance.

Communicates the relatedness assessment of the exposure to the reaction and is therefore mandatory. For SNOMED this will communicate the full assessment. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.
For SNOMED this will include the actual assessment. For non-SNOMED, this should be fixed to RXNASSESS.
Indicates the type of assessment being made
Creates the link between the exposure and the reaction. Because the details of the assessment will be communicated in the 'code' attribute for SNOMED, this element is optional.
This attribute will not be populated if using SNOMED. Otherwise it should have a fixed value of "RELATED".
Indicates whether the reaction is deemed to be related to the exposure.
Identification of offending substance is needed for management of the reaction.
Indicates the specific substance involved in the incidence that caused the reaction.
Provides a record of a patient's allergy changes, providing deeper clinical understanding, particularly of past clinical decisions.
This records the history of changes that have been made to the allergy/intolerance, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.
This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.
Identifies what kind of change occurred. Allergy/Intolerance change types are Revise, Reactivate and Complete.
Allows applications to sort and filter by time. The date on which a change is effective should always be known and thus is mandatory.
The date on which the various changes of an allergy/intolerance become valid and applicable.
Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.
Denotes the reason the the allergy/intolerance was changed.
Communicates the cause of the adverse reaction.

Incidence of the patient's exposure to (or contact with) with some material that might have caused the adverse reaction.

Examples of exposures include: Administering a substance (drug, food, etc) to the patient, Patient coming into contact with an environmental material, etc.
Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure
Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.
Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.
The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.
The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.
Allows for establishment of timelines between onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.
The date on which the allergy/intolerance was reported.
Value is not permitted when using SNOMED, mandatory otherwise
Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with drug contraindication checking.
A record of a patient's allergy or intolerance.
Allows for direct referencing of an allergy/intolerance record when querying or performing updates and is therefore mandatory.
Unique identifier for an allergy/intolerance record.

Allows for the separation of allergy and intolerance records. The type of condition is critical to understanding the record and is therefore mandatory. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.
A coded value denoting whether the record pertains to an intolerance or a true allergy. (Allergies result from immunologic reactions. Intolerances do not.)
Allows providers to refute a previously confirmed or suspected allergy. Because it is essential to know whether the record refutes or affirms an allergy, this attribute is mandatory.
An indication that the allergy/intolerance has been refuted. I.e. A clinician has positively determined that the patient does not suffer from a particular allergy or intolerance.
Allows providers to evaluate the relevance of a recorded allergy/intolerance. The status has a default value of 'active' and is therefore mandatory.
System must default the status to 'ACTIVE'.
"Identifies what kind of change occurred. Allergy/Intolerance change types are Revise, Reactivate and Complete
Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the allergy/intolerance record.
The date on which the recorded allergy is considered active.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Denotes access restriction placed on the allergy or intolerance record. Methods for accessing masked allergy records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.). The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Helps other providers to make appropriate decisions in their management of allergy or intolerance contraindications.

Attribute is mandatory because an allergy or intolerance record must be tagged as either 'confirmed' or 'suspected'.

An indication of the level of confidence/surety placed in the recorded information.

The two valid codes are:

- U (stated with uncertainty) -Specifies that the author of the act affirms the uncertainty of the act statement. In other words, they know that parts of the act statement are not certain or are inferred. An example of this is an inferred prescription where some order data is inferred from a supply event (i.e. dispense).

- N (stated with no assertion of uncertainty) - Specifies that the act statement is made without any explicit expression of certainty/uncertainty. This is the normal statement, meaning that it may not be free of errors and uncertainty may still exist. In healthcare, N is believed to express certainty to the strength possible.

An allergy or intolerance record is always used in drug contraindication checking whether the record is U or N.
Critical for identifying the allergy or intolerance. However, because the attribute is not used for SNOMED, it is optional.
Indicates the substance to which the patient is allergic

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the allergy/intolerance was recorded. The location of entry should always be known, and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the service delivery location where the allergy was recorded.
Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.
Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.
Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.
Value must not be present when using SNOMED, mandatory otherwise
Allows for direct referencing of an adverse reaction record which was previously recorded.
An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.
Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.
If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.
Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.

Allows providers to confirm or eliminate specific agents as being the cause for the allergy/intolerance. E.g. If a reaction is recorded for Tylenol 3, but no reaction is recorded for regular Tylenol or for coffee, this suggests that the likely cause of the allergy is Codeine.

Because it is essential to know whether the record reflects a reaction that did or did not occur, this attribute is mandatory.
Indicates that there was no adverse reaction when the patient was exposed to the agent to which an allergy/intolerance has been recorded.
Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.
A free form description of the reaction.
Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.
The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.
Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.

Allows exposing how an allergy/intolerance record has changed over time. Multiple previous versions may be accessed by chaining versions (C replaces version B replaces version A, etc.). Used when the content underwent more than just a status change.
A complete representation of a previous version of the same allergy/intolerance record.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.
Identity of the provider who is taking responsibility for the actions of the author.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.
Identity of the provider who is taking responsibility for the actions of the author.
Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.
This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.
AllergyIntolerance.severity

Allows for sorting of allergy records. May influence whether contraindications must be managed.

Because SNOMED handles this concept by pre-coordinating it into code, this association is optional.
Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.
Provides support for the agent identified as the allergen/intolerance source.
Indicates the agent that is believed to have caused the adverse reaction.
Not permitted if using SNOMED.
Allows providers to evaluate the significance of the allergy or intolerance. Because severity is pre-coordinated with code for SNOMED, this association is optional.
An indication of the severity of the reaction.
Not permitted if using SNOMED.
Useful for determining severity of an allergy/intolerance contraindication and the management of same. Because severity is pre-coordinated with code for SNOMED, this association is optional.
Indicates the severity of the allergy/intolerance.
AllergyIntolerance.person
Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the person suffering from the allergy/intolerance.
Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.
Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this allergy/intolerance.

Allows providers to understand what the status of a particular allergy/intolerance was on a given date. Historical statuses may impact views of previous clinical decisions, such as contraindication managements.
Shows how the status of the allergy has changed over time.
May help ascertain the severity of the condition, and provide direction for management. Also helps demonstrate the distinction between allergies and intolerances
Indicates a particular type of reaction experienced by the patient or testing performed on the patient which provides evidence for the existence (or non-existence) of the allergy/intolerance.
AllergyIntolerance.authorizingProvider
AllergyIntolerance.authorizingPhysician
Identifies responsibility for accuracy and relevance of the information. This association reflects primary responsibility, and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the provider who caused the condition to be recorded.
Identifies timing of the medical condition for sorting and for audit purposes. Attribute is populated because the source of the data may not be through the 'record common observation' interaction.
The date and time on which the medical condition record was created.

In an EHR integrated health services environment, it is important that other providers are able to query who is responsible for status changes. Also used by applications for auditing. The provider responsible for a change should always be known and is therefore mandatory.
Identity of the health service provider responsible for the change in the medical condition.

Gives other providers the frame of reference in evaluating any post-change issues with the medical condition. Also used for sorting and audit purposes. Time of change is always known and thus the attribute is mandatory.
The date and time on which the change was made.
Provides an audit trail of a patient's medical condition changes.
This indicates the history of changes that have been made to the medical condition record, including why the changes were made, who made them and when.
This attribute is mandatory to ensure that change types are distinguishable.
Identifies what kind of change occurred.

documentation.businessName: A:Medical Condition Status Change Effective Date

annotation.text:
Allows applications to sort and filter by time.

The effective date can be defaulted to change date, and thus is mandatory.
The date on which the changes to the medical condition become valid and applicable.
Ensures consistent terminology in capturing and interpreting reasons for change. Allows CWE because not all reasons will correspond to a pre-defined code.
Denotes the reason the medical condition record was changed.
The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.
Allows for establishment of timelines between onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.
The date on which the medical condition was reported.

Indicates where records are likely kept for follow-up. May also be useful in understanding the context in which the medical condition recorded.

The location of entry should always exist, and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the service delivery location where the medical condition was recorded.
Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED
Code is fixed to DX if not using SNOMED
Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with contraindication checking.
A record of a patient's medical condition. Includes diseases, disabilities, pregnancy, lactation and other clinical conditions of interest.
Allows for direct referencing of a medical condition record when querying or updating and is therefore mandatory.
Unique identifier for medical condition record.

If SNOMED is used, the diagnosis will appear here. Otherwise, a fixed value of "DX" should be sent.
Indicates what kind of condition is being reported.
Essential to evaluating the relevance of the condition record. In some cases, it may not be known whether the condition still exists or not. Therefore the status is treated as 'populated'.
A coded value that indicates whether the condition is still impacting the patient. 'ACTIVE' means the condition is still affecting the patient. 'COMPLETE' means the condition no longer holds
Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the medical condition.

The date on which the condition first began and when it ended.

For ongoing conditions such as chronic diseases, the upper boundary may be unknown.

For transient conditions such as pregnancy, lactation, etc; the upper boundary of the period would usually be specified to signify the end of the condition.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Denotes access restriction placed on the medical condition record. Methods for accessing masked medical condition records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.
This is the central piece of information in recording a condition. However because when using SNOMED the actual diagnosis will be sent in the 'code' attribute, this element is optional.
A code indicating the specific condition. E.g. Hypertension, Pregnancy.
Allows exposing how a medical condition record has changed over time. Multiple previous versions may be accessed by chaining versions (C replaces version B replaces version A, etc.)
A complete representation of a previous version of the same medical condition record at a previous time.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.
Identity of the provider who is taking responsibility for the actions of the author.
Allows for the trail of responsibility for the action.
Identity of the provider who is taking responsibility for the actions of the author.
Allows providers to understand what the status of a particular medical condition was on a given date. Historical statuses may impact views of previous clinical actions.
Shows how the status of the medical condition has changed over time.
AllergyIntolerance.person
Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the person affected by the condition
Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to share un-coded free-form information about a condition.
Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this medical condition.

Allows the recording provider the ability to designate certain conditions as chronic. This is especially useful in jurisdictions where the code scheme used for medical condition does not convey such information

This association behaves like a mandatory boolean attribute where the presence of the association indicates 'true' and the absence of the association indicates false.
If true, indicates that the recorded medical condition is deemed to be chronic.
Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.
A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.
If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted. Otherise code must be RXNASSESS and value must be RELATED
Indicates both the product and how related they are determined to be to the reaction.
This is a recording of the exposures and causality assessment deemed to be related to the reaction.

Communicates the relatedness assessment of the exposure to the reaction and is therefore mandatory. For SNOMED this will communicate the full assessment. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.
For SNOMED this will include the actual assessment. For non-SNOMED, this should be fixed to RXNASSES.
Indicates the type of assessment being made
Creates the link between the exposure and the reaction. Because the details of the assessment will be communicated in the 'code' attribute for SNOMED, this element is optional.
This attribute will not be populated if using SNOMED. Otherwise it should have a fixed value of "RELATED".
Indicates whether the reaction is deemed to be related to the exposure.
Identification of offending substance is needed for management of the reaction.
Indicates the specific substance involved in the incidence that caused the reaction.
Communicates the cause of the adverse reaction.

Incidence of the patient's exposure to (or contact with) with some material that might have caused the adverse reaction.

Examples of exposures include: Administering a substance (drug, food, etc) to the patient, Patient coming into contact with an environmental material, etc.
Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure
Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.
Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.
The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.
The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.
Allows for establishment of timelines between reaction onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.
The date on which the adverse reaction was reported.
Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.
Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.
Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.
Provides a human-readable name in circumstances where the agent is captured as code.
Indicates the name of the agent identified by MaterialKind.code
Value must be mandatory if not using SNOMED
Code must be fixed to DX if not using SNOMED

Useful in tracking reactions when it is not known precisely what product they are associated with and whether the reaction is due to an allergy or intolerance, a drug interaction or some other cause. Effectively gives a 'heads up' to clinicians using the drug or combination of drugs.
This is a record of an adverse reaction considered relevant to the patient's clinical record.
Uniquely identifies the specific reaction record and is therefore mandatory.
An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.
Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.
If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.
Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.
Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.
A free form description of the reaction.
Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.
The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their adverse reaction data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their adverse reactions. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.
Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.
Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.
This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.
AllergyIntolerance.severity

Allows for sorting of reactions. May influence whether contraindications must be managed.

Because SNOMED pre-coordinates severity into code, this association is optional
Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.
Not permitted for SNOMED
Useful for determining severity of an allergy/intolerance contraindication and the management of same. Because severity is communicated as part of code for SNOMED, this association is optional.
Indicates the severity of the allergy/intolerance.
AllergyIntolerance.person
Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the person who suffered the adverse reaction.
Allows linking the reaction to one or more drugs so that they can be flagged in the future when prescribed or dispensed.
Indicates the agent(s) that are suspected to have been involved in the adverse reaction.
Allows the provider to zero in on specific culprits for the adverse reaction.
A specific material or agent that to which the patient was exposed. Examples are: Codein (Drug), Peanut (Food), etc.
If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted, otherwise it is mandatory.
Provides evidence for recording the allergy/intolerance.
Indicates the specific allergy test that supports the recording of the allergy/intolerance.
Allows an allergy/intolerance test record to be directly referenced.
An identifier for a specific instance of an allergy/intolerance test.

A coded value denoting the type of allergy test conducted.
Allows providers to evaluate the currency of the test.
The date on which the allergy test was performed.

Allows other providers to evaluate the test. There is no point in associating an allergy test with unknown results with an allergy or intolerance however the element is optional because this information may be post-coordinated in the 'code' attribute using SNOMED.
A code indicating result of the allergy test.
If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted otherwise code must be RXNASSESS and value must be RELATED

Allows for drilling down to retrieve further information about the exposure
Identifier of the exposure event that caused the adverse reaction. This could be an identifier for a prescription, immunization, or other active medication record.
Helps evaluate the cause of the reaction.
The method by which the patient was exposed to the substance.
The original source of the information can be important in evaluating its accuracy and importance.

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.
Allows for establishment of timelines between onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.
The date on which the allergy/intolerance was reported.
Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with drug contraindication checking.
A record of a patient's allergy or intolerance.
Indicates the allergy or intolerance record to be updated and is therefore mandatory.
Unique identifier for an allergy/intolerance record.

Allows for the separation of allergy and intolerance records. The type of condition is critical to understanding the record and is therefore mandatory. It is expressed as a CD to allow for SNOMED post-coordination.
A coded value denoting whether the record pertains to an intolerance or a true allergy. (Allergies result from immunologic reactions. Intolerances do not.)
Allows providers to refute a previously confirmed or suspected allergy. Because it is essential to know whether the allergy or intolerance is being refuted or affirmed, this attribute is mandatory.
An indication that the allergy/intolerance has been refuted. I.e. A clinician has positively determined that the patient does not suffer from a particular allergy or intolerance.
Allows providers to evaluate the relevance of a recorded allergy/intolerance. The status has a default value of 'ACTIVE' and is therefore mandatory.
System must default the status to 'ACTIVE'.
A coded value that indicates whether an allergy/intolerance is 'ACTIVE' or 'COMPLETE' (indicating no longer active).
Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the allergy/intolerance record.
The date on which the recorded allergy is considered active.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Denotes access restriction placed on the allergy or intolerance record. Methods for accessing masked allergy records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.). The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.

Helps other providers to make appropriate decisions in their management of allergy or intolerance contraindications.

Attribute is mandatory because an allergy or intolerance record must be tagged as either 'confirmed' or 'suspected'.

An indication of the level of confidence/surety placed in the recorded information.

The two valid codes are:

- U (stated with uncertainty) -Specifies that the author of the act affirms the uncertainty of the act statement. In other words, they know that parts of the act statement are not certain or are inferred. An example of this is an inferred prescription where some order data is inferred from a supply event (i.e. dispense).

- N (stated with no assertion of uncertainty) - Specifies that the act statement is made without any explicit expression of certainty/uncertainty. This is the normal statement, meaning that it may not be free of errors and uncertainty may still exist. In healthcare, N is believed to express certainty to the strength possible.

An allergy or intolerance record is always used in drug contraindication checking whether the record is U or N.
Allows exposed materials or agents to be collectively referenced.
Category of material or agent to which the patient was exposed.

Allows different kinds of reaction agents to be distinguished. Coding strength is set to CWE because the exposure agent type may not always be codified. The attribute is populated because there is little point in communicating about the exposure to an agent if it is not known what the agent is, however it may not always be coded.
Indicates the type of agent that the patient was exposed to which caused the adverse reaction. This includes Drug, Food, Latex, Dust, etc.
If code is SNOMED, value is not permitted, otherwise it is mandatory and code must be DX
Allows for direct referencing of an adverse reaction record which was previously recorded.
An identifier assigned to the record of the adverse reaction.
Indicates that the observation is actually a diagnosis and is therefore mandatory. The datatype is CD to support SNOMED post-coordination.
If using SNOMED, this will contain the diagnosis. Otherwise it will be a fixed value of 'DX'.
Indicates the type of diagnosis being captured.

Allows providers to confirm or eliminate specific agents as being the cause for the allergy/intolerance. E.g. If a reaction is recorded for Tylenol 3, but no reaction is recorded for regular Tylenol or for coffee, this suggests that the likely cause of the allergy is Codeine.

Because it is essential to know whether the reaction occurred or not, this attribute is mandatory.
Indicates that there was no adverse reaction when the patient was exposed to the agent to which an allergy/intolerance has been recorded.
Allows for flexibility in the recording and reporting of the reaction.
A free form description of the reaction.
Indicates when evidence of the condition first appeared. May also provide information on the duration of the reaction.
The date on which the reaction occurrence began.

Ensures consistency in tracking and categorizing the reaction type. Helps ensure that only proper allergies are categorized as allergy. The attribute is optional because it will not be used for SNOMED. The attribute is CWE because not all possible types of reactions are expressible by coded values.
Specifies the kind of reaction, as experienced by the patient.
Indicates both the product and how related they are determined to be to the reaction.
Allows providers to determine appropriate managements for contraindications involving such medical conditions.
This is a ranking/ an assertion of the seriouness of the diagnosed/reported medical condition.
AllergyIntolerance.severity

Allows for sorting of allergy records. May influence whether contraindications must be managed.

Because SNOMED pre-coordinates severity into code, this association is optional
Indicates the gravity of the allergy, intolerance or reaction in terms of its actual or potential impact on the patient.
Provides support for the agent identified as the allergen/intolerance source.
Indicates the agent that is believed to have caused the adverse reaction.
Not permitted for SNOMED, required otherwise
Allows providers to evaluate the significance of the allergy or intolerance. Because severity is pre-coordinated into code when using SNOMED, this association is optional.
An indication of the severity of the reaction.
Useful for determining severity of an allergy/intolerance contraindication and the management of same. Because severity is pre-coordinated into code when using SNOMED, this association is optional.
Indicates the severity of the allergy/intolerance.
AllergyIntolerance.person
Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the person suffering from the allergy/intolerance.
May help ascertain the severity of the condition, and provide direction for management. Also helps demonstrate the distinction between allergies and intolerances
Indicates a particular type of reaction experienced by the patient or testing performed on the patient which provides evidence for the existence (or non-existence) of the allergy/intolerance.

Allows the recording provider the ability to designate certain conditions as chronic. This is especially useful in jurisdictions where the code scheme used for medical condition does not convey such information.

The association behaves as a mandatory boolean where the presence of the association represents 'true' while the absence represents 'false'.
If present, indicates that the recorded medical condition is deemed to be chronic.
Allows for establishment of timelines between reported date and recorded date.

Indicates where the information that led to the recording of this information came from. The possible 3 sources of the information are: the patient, the patient's representative or a health-care provider.
Allows for establishment of timelines between onset date, reported date and recorded date, and is therefore mandatory.
The date on which the medical condition was reported.
Value is mandatory if not using SNOMED
Code is fixed to DX if not using SNOMED
Necessary component of a person's overall medication and clinical profile. Helps with contraindication checking.
A record of a patient's medical condition. Includes diseases, disabilities, pregnancy, lactation and other clinical conditions of interest.
Allows for direct referencing of a medical condition record when querying or updating and is therefore mandatory.
Unique identifier for medical condition record to be updated.
Identifies this observation as reporting a medical condition and is therefore mandatory. When using SNOMED, the actual condition may be post-coordinated into this attribute, thus CD is used.
If SNOMED is used, the diagnosis will appear here. Otherwise, a fixed value of "DX" should be sent.
Indicates what kind of condition is being reported.
Essential to evaluating the relevance of the condition record. In some cases, it may not be known whether the condition still exists or not. Therefore the status is treated as 'populated'.
A coded value that indicates whether the condition is still impacting the patient. 'ACTIVE' means the condition is still affecting the patient. 'COMPLETE' means the condition no longer holds
Allows providers to evaluate the period of relevance for the medical condition.

The date on which the condition first began and when it ended.

For ongoing conditions such as chronic diseases, the upper boundary may be unknown.

For transient conditions such as pregnancy, lactation, etc; the upper boundary of the period would usually be specified to signify the end of the condition.

Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint to reflect the wishes of the patient.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Denotes access restriction placed on the medical condition record. Methods for accessing masked medical condition records will be governed by each jurisdiction (e.g. court orders, shared secret/consent, etc.).

The default confidentiality level is 'NORMAL'.
This is the central piece of information in recording a condition. However because when using SNOMED the actual diagnosis will be sent in the 'code' attribute, this element is optional.
A code indicating the specific condition. E.g. Hypertension, Pregnancy.
Chronic Indicator must not be present if using SNOMED
AllergyIntolerance.person
Ties the condition to a particular patient record, and is therefore mandatory.
Identifies the person affected by the condition

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for medical condition data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.
Indicates whether or not notes attached to the medical condition records are to be returned along with the detailed information.
Useful in retrieving incremental changes to the patient's record.
Filters the query response to only include medical conditions which have been created or modified within the date-range specified
Allows for the selective retrieval of medical condition records based on the status of the record.

Indicates that the result set should be filtered to included only those medical condition records for the specified status.

Valid statuses include: ACTIVE or COMPLETE.
Root class for query definition
Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response
Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the date on which the patient was born.
Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.
Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid
Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the medical condition query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.
Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

The name of the patient who is the subject of the medical condition query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.

Allows for the flexibility of omitting/including notes in the retrieval of information for adverse reactions data.

Because the attribute is boolean, it must explicitly indicate a 'TRUE' or 'FALSE', and thus it is mandatory.
Indicates whether or not notes attached to the adverse reactions records are to be returned along with the detailed information.
Root class for query definition
Defines the set of parameters that may be used to filter the query response.
Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the date on which the patient was born.
Used to confirm the identity of the patient for the query and is therefore mandatory.
Indicates the gender (sex) of the patient.
Allows filtering of result set by patient Id. This is a mandatory field because a patient must be specified for the query to be valid
Identifier of the patient who is the subject of the adverse reaction query. Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this Id.
Allows filtering of result set by patient name. This is a mandatory field because a patient name must match the patient Id for the query to be valid.

The name of the patient who is the subject of the adverse reaction query.

Filter the result set to include only those records pertaining to the patient with this name.
Allows the requester to specify the adverse reaction period of interest for retrieval of adverse reaction records. Useful to avoid run-away queries.
The period in which the recorded adverse reaction occurred or was updated. I.e. Filters the result-set to those reactions whose onset occurred within the time-range specified by this parameter.
Allows the requester to retrieve only those allergy/intolerance records for which there was a specific type of reaction.

Indicates that the result set be filtered to include only those allergy/intolerance records for which specific type of reaction was recorded.

Reaction types include: STEVEN JOHNSON, ANAPHYLAXIS, NAUSEA, etc

Allows the service-event to be located in a particular time. Because a time won't always be known, the attribute is only marked as "populated". The duration of the consultation may also be of clinical interest.
The date and time on which the professional service was performed, as well as the duration of the service.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their medication data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their professional service record. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.
PatientConsultation.personRepresentative
Allows the content to be linked to the person's EHR. As a result, this association is mandatory.
Identity of the person who received the professional service.
Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.
Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this professional service occurrence.
Measurement Type with a nullFlavorvalue must have SubObservations Measurement Type without a nullFlavor value must not have SubObservations.
Allows pertinent patient measurements to be recorded for clinical purposes.
This comprises a single point-in-time measurement made about a patient.

Distinguishes what kind of information is being specified.

The attribute is CD to support SNOMED
Identification of the type of measurement/observation that was made about the patient. Observation types include: height, weight, blood pressure, body mass, etc
OBS.010-04 NCPDP:Clinical.494-ZE NCPDP:Clinical.495-H1

Allows providers to evaluate currency of the information. Because the date of observation/measurement determines the relevance of the information, this attribute is defined as 'populated'. Also allows tracking of observations over time.
The dateand time at which the observation applies. E.g., if blood was drawn two days ago and White Blood Count (WBC) was done today, then WBC observation date should reflect the date of two days ago.

Allows the patient to have discrete control over access to their common observation data.

The attribute is optional because not all systems will support masking.

Communicates the intent of the patient to restrict access to their common observations. Provides support for additional confidentiality constraint, giving patients a level of control over their information. Valid values are: 'NORMAL' (denotes 'Not Masked'); and 'RESTRICTED' (denotes 'Masked'). The default is 'NORMAL' signifying 'Not Masked'.
OBS.010-02 (value) eScript:OBS.010-03 (unit) NCPDP:Clinical.595-H4 (value) NCPDP:Clinical.495-H3 (unit)
Provides standard representation of the measurement. May be used in calculations.

The amount (quantity and unit) that has been recorded for the specific type of observation. E.g. height in centimeters, weight in kilograms, etc.

Valid observation unit types are: kg, cm, mmHg, mmol/mL, L/min, C, 1/min, etc
Participation must be either zero or 2, and nothing else
Needed for more complex observations such as blood pressure.
Indicates sub-measurements that combine to make up the overall measurement.
The same Measurement Type may not be specified in both the SubObservationEvent and the CommonObservationEvent.
Allows both parts to be captured as part of a single measurement.
Represents one of the two components (systolic and diastolic) of a blood pressure measurement.

Distinguishes between the two types of blood pressure measurements.

Code is mandatory to ensure that blood pressure observations are distinguishable. The attribute is CD to support SNOMED
Distinguishes between the two types of blood measurement. This can either be code for SYSTOLIC or DYSTOLIC

Provides standard representation of the blood pressure measurement. May be used in calculations. Attribute is defined as mandatory to ensure that a value is always supplied, if there is a blood pressure measurement.
The amount (quantity and unit) that has been recorded for the blood pressure.
Improves communication between providers by allowing a mechanism to exchange un-coded free-form information.
Indicates the various comments that providers have recorded about this common observation.
Allows the observation to be attached to the appropriate person's record. As a result, this association is mandatory.
Identity of the person being observed.
Allows linking the service to the person responsible for requesting it.
Represents the order or prescription against which the service was performed.

Requests that the specified annotation be recorded against the identified patient
Indicates that the specified annotation has been successfully recorded against the requested patient.
Indicates that the request to record the annotation against a particular patient has been denied.
Requests that the specified patient annotation be marked as no longer applicable.
Indicates that the specified patient annotation has been successfully marked as no longer applicable.
Indicates that the request to mark the specified patient annotation as no longer applicable has been refused.
Requests retrieval of the notes that have been recorded against a particular patient, potentially filtered by note type and/or date.
Returns the notes that have been recorded against a particular patient, potentially filtered by note type and/or date.
Requests that the specified annotation be recorded against a particular record.

documentation.businessName: Add note to record request accepted

annotation.text: Indicates that the specified annotation has been successfully recorded against the requested record.

documentation.businessName: Add note to record request refused

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to record the annotation against a particular record has been denied.

Requests that an identified item, group of items (identified by act type, medication, indication) or all items for a particular patient should have their confidentiality code changed to the specified value.

Indicates that the confidentiality code has been successfully revised for the requested identified item, group of items (identified by act type, medication, indication) or all items for a particular patient.
Indicates that the requested confidentiality code change has been denied.
Sends a broadcast message to all or a subset of users of a given system; (Used for alerts regarding system outages or other urgent messages).
Seeks to have an identified ControlAct nullified, essentially reversing the record of the event.
Indicates that an identified ControlAct has been nullified as requested, essentially reversing the record of the event.
Indicates that the request to nullify an identified ControlAct has been denied, leaving the original event in force.
Requests that the specified issue be updated to include the identified management(s).
Indicates that the specified issue has been successfully updated to include the identified management(s).
Indicates that the request to update an issue with identified management(s) has been denied.
Sends HL7 Accept Acknowledgement
Sends HL7 Poll Transmission to an HL7 interaction queue manager.
Requests an indication of the number and priority of outstanding interactions (if any) on the application's poll queue.
Returns an indication of the number and priority of outstanding interactions (if any) on the application's poll queue.
Requests that a particular immunization be added to a patient's record.
Indicates that the requested immunization information has been successfully added to the patient's record.
Indicates that the request to add an immunization to the patient record has been denied.
Request that information about a previously recorded immunization be changed.
Indicates that information about a change to a previously recorded immunization has been successfully recorded.
Indicates that the request to record a change to information about a previously recorded immunization has been refused.
Asks that a previously recorded immunization should be ""removed"" from the record; (Information may be retained for audit purposes).
Indicates that a previously recorded immunization has been ""removed"" from the record as requested; (Information may have been retained for audit purposes).
Indicates that the requested previously recorded immunization will not be ""removed"" from the record;

Requests retrieval of detailed information about a patient's immunizations, potentially filtered by time-range of the immunization, time-range the immunization was last updated, and/or type of immunization.
Returns detailed information about a patient's immunizations.

Requests retrieval of a specific monograph or set of monographs for a particular medication (specified by identifier) or indication. The type of monograph (provider, patient, long, short, etc.) may be specified.
Returns one or more drug, protocol or contraindication monographs as text, HTML, PDF or CDA documents.
Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single drug product by product code.
Returns detailed information about a single drug product.
Requests retrieval of a lists of candidate drugs based on various search criteria such as name, route, code, manufacturer, appearance, etc.
Returns a list of basic identifying and descriptive information about one or more medications.
Requests that the specified ""refusal to fill"" note be recorded against the identified prescription.

documentation.businessName: Record refusal to dispense request accepted

annotation.text: Indicates that the requested ""refusal to fill"" note has been recorded against the identified prescription.

documentation.businessName: Record refusal to dispense request refused

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to record a ""refusal to fill"" against a prescription has been refused.
Indicates that the responsibility for fulfilling the dispense portion of a prescription has changed.

documentation.businessName: Revise assigned dispense responsibility req. acc.

annotation.text: Indicates that the responsibility for fulfilling the dispense portion of a prescription has been changed to the requested facility.

documentation.businessName: Revise assigned dispense responsibility req. ref.

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to change the facility responsible for fulfilling the dispense portion of a prescription has been refused.
Requests that a device prescription be recorded against the patient's record.
Requests that a medication prescription be recorded against the patient's record.
Indicates that a medication prescription has been recorded against the patient's record as requested.
Indicates that the request to record a medication prescription against the patient's record as been refused.
Requests the specified medication prescription proposal be reviewed, and any detected issues be identified.
Requests that the specified prescription be suspended.
Indicates that the requested prescription has been suspended.
Indicates that the request to suspend specified prescription has been refused.
Requests that the specified prescription be released.
Indicates that the requested prescription has been released.
Indicates that the request to release specified prescription has been refused.
Requests that a prescription be marked as ""no longer dispensable but still administrable"".
Indicates that the requests prescription has been marked as ""no longer dispensable but still administrable"".
Indicates that the request to mark a prescription as ""no longer dispensable but still administrable"" has been refused.
Indicates that the specified medication prescription proposal was reviewed and no issues were detected.
Indicates that the specified issues were found in reviewing the requested medication prescription proposal.
Requests that the specified facility dispense the medication prescription transmitted by this interaction and does not expect a response interaction
Requests that a prescriber issue a renewal prescription based on a previously existing prescription.
Indicates that the requested prescription has been renewed by a new prescription, referenced by identifier.
Indicates that the request for the issuance of a prescription has been refused.
Requests that the specified prescription be aborted (further dispensing or administrative must cease).
Indicates that the requested prescription has been aborted (further dispensing or administrative must cease)
Indicates that the request to abort specified prescription has been refused.
Requests that the specified facility dispense the device prescription transmitted by this interaction and does not expect a response interaction
Indicates that a device prescription has been recorded against the patient's record as requested.
Indicates that the request to record a device prescription against the patient's record as been refused.

Requests that the device dispense processing (drug preparation, packaging and contraindication checking) for a particular quantity of devices against a prescription has been performed and the medication is awaiting pickup ne recorded.
Indicates that a previously processed prescription has now been picked up.
Requests that the pickup of a previously processed prescription be recorded.
Indicates that the pickup of the prescription has been recorded as requested
Indicates that the request to record the pickup of the specified prescription has been refused.
Indicates that the requested medication dispense processing information has been successfully recorded in the patient's record.
Indicates that the request to record the medication dispense processing has been refused.
Requests that a bulk supply of a medication to a facility be recorded.

documentation.businessName: Record supply event (ward stock) request accept

annotation.text: Indicates the requested bulk supply of a medication to a facility has been recorded.

documentation.businessName: Record supply event (ward stock) request refused

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to record a bulk supply of a medication to a facility has been refused.

documentation.businessName: Record device disp. processing request refused

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to record the device dispense processing has been refused.

documentation.businessName: Record device disp. processing request accepted

annotation.text: Indicates that the requested device dispense processing information has been successfully recorded in the patient's record.
Requests that a previously submitted dispense be marked as reversed. The medication has been disposed of without having been picked up nor consumed by the patient.
Indicates that the reversal of the prescription has been recorded as requested
Indicates that the request to record the reversal of the specified prescription has been refused.
Requests that a medication be recorded against the patient's record.
Indicates that the requested medication has been successfully recorded.
Indicates that the request to add the medication has been denied.
Requests that status, comments or other information about an existing medication record be modified.
Indicates that the requested status, comments and/or other information about an existing medication record have been successfully modified.
Indicates that the request to update information about an existing medication record has been refused.
Requests retrieval of the contraindications associated with issuing a particular combination of drugs based only on a list of concomitant medications.

Indicates the contraindications (if any) associated with a set of medications. Only includes drug-drug and duplicate therapy contraindications because that's all that is deducible based on a list of medications.
Requests retrieval of the potential contraindications associated with issuing a specified medication to a particular patient based on their existing medication and clinical profile.

documentation.businessName: Device prescr. with hist. and disp. query

annotation.text: Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single identified device prescription, including history of changes and all fulfilling dispense events.

documentation.businessName: Device prescr. with hist. and disp. query resp.

annotation.text: Returns detailed information about a single identified device prescription, including history of changes and all fulfilling dispense events.
Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single identified device dispense event.

documentation.businessName: Device prescription dispense detail query response

annotation.text: Returns detailed information about a single identified device dispense event.
Requests retrieval of basic information about all device dispenses provided to a particular patient, potentially filtered by date.

documentation.businessName: Device prescription dispense summary query resp.

annotation.text: Returns basic information about all device dispenses provided to a particular patient.
Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single device prescription referenced by id, optionally including detailed dispense information.
Returns detailed information about a single device prescription referenced by id, optionally including detailed dispense information.
Requests retrieval of basic information about all dispenses performed against a particular device prescription referenced by id
Returns basic information about all dispenses performed against a particular device prescription referenced by id.
Requests retrieval of basic information about all device prescriptions provided to a single patient, optionally filtered by date and status.
Returns basic information about all device prescriptions provided to a single patient, optionally filtered by date and status.

documentation.businessName: Med. prescr. with hist. and dispenses query

annotation.text: Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single identified medication prescription, including history of changes and all fulfilling dispense events

documentation.businessName: Med. prescr. with hist. and dispenses query resp.

annotation.text: Returns detailed information about a single identified medication prescription, including history of changes and all fulfilling dispense events.
Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single identified medication dispense event.
Returns detailed information about a single identified medication dispense event.
Requests basic information about all medication dispenses provided to a particular patient, potentially filtered by date.
Returns basic information about all medication dispenses provided to a particular patient.
Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single medication prescription referenced by id, optionally including detailed dispense information.
Returns detailed information about a single medication prescription referenced by id, optionally including detailed dispense information.
Requests retrieval of basic information about all medication dispenses performed against a particular prescription referenced by id
Returns basic information about all medication dispenses performed against a particular prescription referenced by id.
Requests retrieval of basic information about all medication prescriptions provided to a single patient, optionally filtered by date and status.
Returns basic information about medication prescriptions provided to a single patient

Requests retrieval of detailed information about a patient's prescriptions, dispenses and other medications for a specific patient filtered by a variety of criteria, including id, drug, indication, date, etc.

documentation.businessName: Medication profile detail generic query resp.

annotation.text: Returns detailed information about a patient's prescriptions, dispenses and other medications for a specific patient filtered by a variety of criteria, including id, drug, indication, date, etc.
Requests retrieval of detailed information about a patient's prescriptions, dispenses and other medications for a specific patient optionally filtered by date.
Returns detailed information about a patient's prescriptions, dispenses and other medications for a specific patient optionally filtered by date.
Requests retrieval of basic information about a patient's prescriptions, dispenses and other medications for a specific patient optionally filtered by date.
Returns basic information about a patient's prescriptions, dispenses and other medications for a specific patient optionally filtered by date.
Requests retrieval of detailed information about a single ""other medication"" record, referenced by identifier.
Returns detailed information about a single ""other medication"" record, referenced by identifier.

Requests retrieval of basic information about all prescriptions provided to a single patient, prescribed by the specified prescriber which have not yet been dispensed, optionally filtered by date and status.

documentation.businessName: Unfilled prescr. by prescriber query response

annotation.text: Returns basic information about all prescriptions provided to a single patient, prescribed by the specified prescriber which have not yet been dispensed, optionally filtered by date and status.
Requests retrieval of basic information about all prescriptions provided to a single patient which have not yet been dispensed, optionally filtered by date and status.
Returns basic information about all prescriptions provided to a single patient which have not yet been dispensed, optionally filtered by date and status.

documentation.businessName: Record consent or override request accepted

annotation.text: Indicates that the requested consent, revocation of consent or consent override has been successfully recorded for a particular patient.

documentation.businessName: Record consent or override request refused

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to record a consent, revocation of consent or consent override has been refused.
Requests that a consent, revocation of consent or consent override be recorded for a particular patient.
Indicates that the keyword used to control patient access to a all or a portion of the patient's record has been successfully revised to the requested value.
Indicates that the request to revise the patient's keyword has been refused.
Requests that the keyword used to control patient access to a all or a portion of the patient's record be revised to the specified value.
Returns information about the current status of one or more adverse reactions for a patient.
Requests that information about an adverse reaction be recorded against a patient's record.
Indicates that the requested adverse reaction information has been successfully recorded against the patient.
Indicates that the request to record the specified reaction against the patient's record has been refused.
Requests that information such as severity, outcome and suspected cause of a previously-recorded adverse reaction be updated.
Indicates that the requested severity, outcome, suspected cause or other information about a previously-recorded adverse reaction has been successfully updated.
Indicates that the requested modification to the previously-recorded adverse reaction has been refused.
Requests that a new allergy or intolerance record be recorded against the specified patient.
Indicates that the requested allergy or intolerance record has been successfully added to the patient's record.
Indicates that the request to add the specified allergy or intolerance to the patient record has been denied.
Requests retrieval of all allergies or intolerances that have been recorded for a particular patient, optionally filtered by time-range when the allergy or intolerance record has last been changed.
Returns the details of one or more allergy and intolerance records.
Requests retrieval of the history of a particular allergy or intolerance record identified by patient id and allergy or intolerance record id, including changes to severity, status, annotations, etc.

documentation.businessName: Patient allergy/intolerance with hist. query resp.

annotation.text: Returns information about a single allergy or intolerance record, including all revisions to severity, status and annotations.
Requests that status, severity or other information about an existing allergy or intolerance record be updated.
Indicates that the status, severity and/or other information about the requested allergy or intolerance record has been updated.
Indicates that the requested modification to the defined allergy or intolerance record has been denied.
Returns the details of one or more medical condition records.

documentation.businessName: Patient medical condition with hist. query

annotation.text: Requests retrieval of the history of a particular medical condition record identified by patient id and medical condition record id, including changes to severity, status, start date, end date, etc.

documentation.businessName: Patient medical condition with hist. query resp.

annotation.text: Returns information about a single medical condition record, including all revisions to severity, status, start date, end date and annotations.
Requests that a medical condition record be recorded against the specified patient.
Indicates that the requested medical condition record has been successfully added to the patient's record.
Indicates that the request to add the specified medical condition to the patient record has been refused.
Requests that information such as severity, status, start date and end date of a previously-recorded medical condition be updated.
Indicates that the requested severity, status, start date, end date or other information about a previously-recorded medical condition has been successfully updated.
Indicates that the requested modification to the previously-recorded medical condition has been refused.

documentation.businessName: Patient pharmacy prof. services query response

annotation.text: Returns detailed information about some or all professional services (training, counseling, medication reviews, etc.) delivered to a patient.
Seeks to add a record of a professional service (training, counseling, medication reviews, etc.) which has been delivered to a patient.

documentation.businessName: Record pharmacy prof. service request accepted

annotation.text: Indicates that a record of a professional service (training, counseling, medication reviews, etc.) which has been delivered to a patient has been successfully added.

documentation.businessName: Record pharmacy prof. service request refused

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to add a record of a professional service (training, counseling, medication reviews, etc.) which has been delivered to a patient has been refused.
Requests that a basic observation (height, weight, blood-pressure, etc.) be recorded in a patient's record.

documentation.businessName: Record patient basic observation request accepted

annotation.text: Indicates that the requested basic observation (height, weight, blood-pressure, etc.) has been successfully recorded in a patient's record.

documentation.businessName: Record patient basic observation request refused

annotation.text: Indicates that the request to record the specified observation in the patient's record has been refused.

Requests retrieval of the basic observations (height, weight, blood-pressure, etc.) which have been recorded for a particular patient, optionally filtered by the type of observation and/or by the date-range for which the observation was recorded.
Returns one or more basic observations (height, weight, blood-pressure, etc.) associated with a patient.
